FuncDef: The display loop-detect traffic-suppression record command displays Layer 2 suppression information generated when Layer 2-loop-based broadcast traffic suppression takes effect.
CLIs: display loop-detect traffic-suppression record [ { vsi <vsi-name> | vlan <vlan-id> } ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a VSI.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the ID of a VLAN.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Examples: Domain Type   Domain ID/Name      Interface/Pw           Peer Ip          VC Label     Cir(kbps)  Time                 State
Total matching items on slot 1 displayed = 9
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To query Layer 2 suppression information generated when Layer 2-loop-based broadcast traffic suppression takes effect, run the display loop-detect traffic-suppression record command. The command output shows Layer 2 suppression information on both PW and AC sides to help fault locating and analyzing.
